Description: Base sherd of Corinthian, probably black-glazed, pottery kotyle; glaze largely fired orange-red; interior glazed; exterior: at top, glazed band with added red line; frieze of narrow rays at base; glaze band on outer edge of foot; wide black band with narrow band in added white on inside of foot; wide and narrow bands on base with large central dot.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels regarding the decoration and firing, see British Museum 1886,0401.646 and Louvre AM1365.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 98, no. A142)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.250) (phase 3)
